solution.text:
Given equations are :
x + _{j}_y = _{k}_ -------(1)
_{i}_x - y = _{l}_ -------(2)
Multiply equation (2) by _{j}_ to make coefficient of y equal.
Then we get the equations:
x + _{j}_y = _{k}_ -------(3)
_{{j*i}}_x - _{j}_y = _{{j*l}}_ -------(4)
Add both the equations.
So, we get
(1+_{{j*i}}_)x + (_{j}_-_{j}_)y = _{k}_+_{{j*l}}_
i.e.,_{{i*j+1}}_x = _{{l*j+k}}_
i.e.,x = \(_{{j*l+k}}_\over _{{i*j+1}}_\)
Now, Substitute the value of x in equation 1.
We get
\(_{{l*j+k}}_\over _{{i*j+1}}_\) + _{j}_y = _{k}_
_{j}_y = _{k}_-\(_{{l*j+k}}_\over _{{i*j+1}}_\)
_{j}_y = \({_{{k*(i*j+1)}}_-_{{l*j+k}}_}\over _{{i*j+1}}_\)
y = \({_{{k*(i*j+1)-(l*j+k)}}_}\over _{{j*(i*j+1)}}_\)
So, the solution required is:
x = \(_{{l*j+k}}_\over _{{i*j+1}}_\) and y = \({_{{k*(i*j+1)-(l*j+k)}}_}\over _{{j*(i*j+1)}}_\)

content.text:
Solve the following equation by the elimination method.
x + _{j}_y = _{k}_ and _{i}_x - y = _{l}_
